name: coc-metals
description: coc.nvim extension for Metals, the Scala language server

scripts.build: tsc --noEmit && parcel build src/index.ts --out-dir lib/ --target node --no-source-maps

metals.serverVersion.markdownDescription:
The version of the Metals server artifact. Requires reloading the window.

**Change only if you know what you're doing**

metals.serverProperties.markdownDescription:
Optional list of properties to pass along to the Metals server. By default, the environment variable `JAVA_OPTS` and `.jvmopts` file are respected. 

Example: `-Dhttps.proxyHost=… -Dhttps.proxyPort=…` or `-Dmetals.statistics=all`

metals.ammoniteJvmProperties.markdownDescription:
Optional list of JVM properties to pass along to the Ammonite server. Each property needs to be a separate item.

Example: `-Xmx1G` or `-Xms100M`

metals.javaHome.markdownDescription:
Optional path to the Java home directory. Requires reloading the window.

Defaults to the most recent Java 8 version computed by the `locate-java-home` npm package.

metals.sbtScript.markdownDescription:
Optional absolute path to an `sbt` executable to use for running `sbt bloopInstall`.

By default, Metals uses `java -jar sbt-launch.jar` with an embedded launcher while respecting `.jvmopts` and `.sbtopts`.

Update this setting if your `sbt` script requires more customizations like using environment variables.

metals.millScript.markdownDescription:
Optional absolute path to a `mill` executable to use for running `mill mill.contrib.Bloop/install`.

By default, Metals uses an embedded `millw` script while respecting `.mill-version` file.

Update this setting if your `mill` script requires more customizations.

metals.mavenScript.markdownDescription:
Optional absolute path to a `mvn` executable to use for running `mvn ch.epfl.scala:maven-bloop_2.10:<bloop_version>:bloopInstall`.

By default, Metals uses an embedded `mvnw` script.

Update this setting if your `mvn` script requires more customizations.

metals.gradleScript.markdownDescription:
Optional absolute path to a `gradle` executable to use for running `gradle bloopInstall`.

By default, Metals uses an embedded `gradlew` ukcript.

Update this setting if your `gradle` script requires more customizations.

metals.scalafmtConfigPath.markdownDescription:
Optional custom path to the .scalafmt.conf file.

Should be an absolute path using forward slashes `/` for file separators (even on Windows).

metals.scalafixConfigPath.markdownDescription:
Optional custom path to the .scalafix.conf file.

Should be an absolute path and use forward slashes `/` for file separators (even on Windows).

metals.bloopVersion.markdownDescription: This version will be used for the Bloop build tool plugin, for any supported build tool, while importing in Metals as well as for running the embedded server

metals.bloopSbtAlreadyInstalled.markdownDescription: If true, Metals will not generate a `project/metals.sbt` file under the assumption that sbt-bloop is already manually installed in the sbt build. Build import will fail with a 'not valid command bloopInstall' error in case Bloop is not manually installed in the build when using this option.

metals.customRepositories.markdownDescription:
Optional list of custom resolvers passed to Coursier when fetching metals dependencies.

For documentation on accepted values see the [Coursier documentation](https://get-coursier.io/docs/other-repositories).

The extension will pass these to Coursier using the COURSIER_REPOSITORIES environment variable after joining the custom repositories with a pipe character (|).

metals.excludedPackages.markdownDescription:
List of packages you'd like to be left out of completions, symbol searches, and code actions.

Ex. `akka.actor.typed.javadsl` will ensure nothing in the `javadsl` package gets recommended to you.

You can find the list of default exclusions [here on the Metals website](https://scalameta.org/metals/docs/editors/new-editor.html#excluded-packages).

If you need to remove one of the defaults, you can simply include it and preface it with `--`.

metals.statusBarEnabled.markdownDescription:
Turn on usage of the statusBar integration.

Note: You need to ensure you are adding something like `%{coc#status()}` in order to display it, or use a plugin with status integration.

metals.superMethodLensesEnabled.description: Enable/disable goto super method code lens

metals.enableStripMarginOnTypeFormatting.markdownDescription: When enabled, if you press the return key from the first line of a multiline string containing a pipe, it will automatically add `.stripMargin.`

metals.treeviews.forceChildrenReload.description: Force the reloading of the children of this node. May be useful when the wrong result is cached and tree contains invalid data.

metals.treeviews.executeCommandAndOpenSp.description: Execute command and open node under cursor in horizontal split (if node is class, trait and so on)

metals.treeviews.executeCommandAndOpenVS.description: Execute command and open node under cursor in vertical split (if node is class, trait and so on)

metals.treeviews.executeCommandAndOpenTa.description: Execute command and open node under cursor in tab (if node is class, trait and so on)

metals.showInferredType.description: When this option is enabled, each method that has infered types have those types displayed as extra info in the hover window.

metals.showImplicitArguments.description: When this option is enabled, each method that has implicit arguments have those aruments displayed as extra info in the hover window.

metals.showImplicitConversionsAndClasses.description: When this option is enabled, each implicit method and class is displayed as extra info in the hover window.

metals.fallbackScalaVersion.markdownDescription:
The Scala compiler version that is used as the default or fallback in case a file doesn't belong to any build target or the specified Scala version isn't supported by Metals.

This applies to standalone Scala files, worksheets, and Ammonite scripts.

commands.title: Connect to a running build server
Disconnect from the build server without restarting
Attempt to generate bsp config for build tool.
Disconnect from the build server without restarting
Execute different operations with Tree Views
Reveal current class, trait or object in Tree View
Start interactive reset choice to clear old decisions.
